NR-AR.name: Aromatic amine
NR-AR.explanation: In organic chemistry, an aromatic amine is an organic compound consisting of an aromatic ring attached to an amine.

NR-AR.name: Alkyl halide
NR-AR.explanation: The haloalkanes are alkanes containing one or more halogen substituents of hydrogen atom.

NR-AR.name: Phenol
NR-AR.explanation: Phenol is an aromatic organic compound with the molecular formula C6H5OH.

NR-AR.name: Thiol
NR-AR.explanation: In organic chemistry, a thiol, or thiol derivative, is any organosulfur compound of the form R−SH, where R represents an alkyl or other organic substituent.

NR-AR.name: Hydrazine
NR-AR.explanation: Hydrazine is an inorganic compound with the chemical formula N2H4.

NR-AR.name: Alkene
NR-AR.explanation: In organic chemistry, an alkene, or olefin, is a hydrocarbon containing a carbon–carbon double bond.

NR-AR.name: Aldehyde
NR-AR.explanation: In organic chemistry, an aldehyde is an organic compound containing a functional group with the structure R−CH=O.

NR-AR.name: Ketone
NR-AR.explanation: In organic chemistry, a ketone is an organic compound with the structure R−C(=O)−R', where R and R' can be a variety of carbon-containing substituents.

SR-MMP.name: Metal chelator
SR-MMP.explanation: Chelation is a type of bonding and sequestration of metal atoms.

SR-MMP.name: Hydroxamic acid
SR-MMP.explanation: In organic chemistry, hydroxamic acids are a class of organic compounds having a general formula R−C(=O)−N(−OH)−R' bearing the functional group −C(=O)−N(−OH)−, where R and R' are typically organyl groups or hydrogen.

SR-MMP.name: Pyridine ring
SR-MMP.explanation: Pyridine is a basic heterocyclic organic compound with the chemical formula C5H5N.

SR-MMP.name: Imidazole
SR-MMP.explanation: Imidazole (ImH) is an organic compound with the formula (CH)3(NH)N.

SR-MMP.name: Sulfonamide
SR-MMP.explanation: In organic chemistry, the sulfonamide functional group is an organosulfur group with the structure R−S(=O)2−NR2.

SR-MMP.name: Hydroxyl group
SR-MMP.explanation: In chemistry, a hydroxy or hydroxyl group is a functional group with the chemical formula −OH and composed of one oxygen atom covalently bonded to one hydrogen atom.

SR-MMP.name: Triazole
SR-MMP.explanation: A triazole is a heterocyclic compound featuring a five-membered ring of two carbon atoms and three nitrogen atoms with molecular formula C2H3N3.

SR-MMP.name: Thiazole
SR-MMP.explanation: Thiazole, or 1,3-thiazole, is a 5-membered heterocyclic compound that contains both sulfur and nitrogen.

SR-MMP.name: Carboxylic acid
SR-MMP.explanation: In organic chemistry, a carboxylic acid is an organic acid that contains a carboxyl group attached to an R-group.

NR-AR-LBD.name: Nitro group
NR-AR-LBD.explanation: In organic chemistry, nitro compounds are organic compounds that contain one or more nitro functional groups.

NR-AR-LBD.name: Epoxide
NR-AR-LBD.explanation: In organic chemistry, an epoxide is a cyclic ether, where the ether forms a three-atom ring: two atoms of carbon and one atom of oxygen.

NR-AR-LBD.name: Alkyl halide
NR-AR-LBD.explanation: The haloalkanes are alkanes containing one or more halogen substituents of hydrogen atom.

NR-AR-LBD.name: Aldehyde
NR-AR-LBD.explanation: In organic chemistry, an aldehyde is an organic compound containing a functional group with the structure R−CH=O.
